snippet: A bill broadening protections for news publishers was approved by German lawmakers, but critics said the measure did not go far enough.
abstract: German lawmakers approve legislation that grants publishers right to charge search engines and other online aggregators for reproducing their content but continues to allow free use of text in links and brief summaries; law is seen as clear attempt to force companies like Google to share some of billions of euros earned from sale of advertising.
lead_paragraph: A bill broadening protections for news publishers was approved by German lawmakers, but critics said the measure did not go far enough.

headline.seo: German Copyright Law Takes Aim at Google Links
headline.main: German Copyright Law Targets Google Links
headline.print_headline: German Copyright Law Takes Aim at Google Links
